page.title: 17Memories of Local People
page.content: Fifty years or more ago many{houses}in the area had no inside toilet.Therewas no electricity and all they had for light was a paraffin lamp.There was no hot water tap and all the hot water had to be heated over the fire. If they wanted to heat a lot of water then they would boil it in a tank beside the fire. {Children}went to the secondary school in Aberfeldy by train.The train left at 7.30.The railway was built in 1865. It carried wood,coal,livestock and potatoes.People were also carried.The three men who worked at Grandtully Station were the porter,clerk and the station master. {Fishing}on the River Tay in those days was excellent. It was so good that any good angler could get a salmon weighing about 20lb at any time he wanted. <continued>
